title: @Riot, With the Juggernaut changes coming out soon...
body:
...Can we PLEASE get a new Brutalizer item? Garen's Judgement not interacting with Crit anymore makes Youmuu's a total waste of gold on him, as it has been for most champions who would build brutalizer in the top lane, while Brutalizer is an essential lane item for AD casters who want to actually snowball an advantage in lane. The whole reason Black Cleaver was reworked the first time was to address this problem and give AD Casters a good item to build their brutalizer into, and while I absolutely love the New Cleaver and its build path, it DOES present one of the major problems that the Previous Cleaver was meant to address. Maybe a new, damage-focused Stark's Fervor? Or something new and imaginative, that'd be cool too. Something more damage-dealing in nature.

Also I'd like to say that even though I've been pretty vocal about a lot of recent changes, RiotRepertoir is fast becoming my favorite Rioter just for being on these forums so much and being so upfront with people. And for actually caring about stuff, even stuff that no other Rioter even talks about, like Quinn. The Ashe rework is perhaps the SINGLE best example of a rework making a champion who was widely thought could never be viable and balanced, and making her a fair, top tier pick. I don't know if he's answered this question before, but I am really curious why he chose to take Crit off of Judgement for the upcoming Garen rework. The actual reasoning and thought process, I mean. At any rate, keep up the good work; I hope that other Rioters will follow your example and be more involved with the community directly in the future as well.

Though someone else in the thread already mentioned it, Garen's E will scale with crit on his update.

With that out of the way, Brutalizer does stick out like a sore thumb right now in that there's only one item that builds out of it, and that item has a pretty niche set of stats. From a few conversations I've had with them, the Game Systems team (the ones who make and rework items) is aware of this oddity and would like to address it in some way, shape, or form soon (though I don't think there's a definitive plan for it).

Have you considered taking a look at Haunting Guise? I'd consider Liandry's FAR more niche as an item than Ghostblade.

What? With the AP item changes, Liandry's gives the same 80 AP as any good non-NLR ap item. The hp-shred is just an added effect on top of that. It's really good right now. The AP changes basically made it so unless all you want is raw damage, you pick for the utility you want each item to give. As a result, Liandry's is pretty good on any mage, tho it obviously works better on DoTs that can reapply it.

As a result, Liandry's is pretty good on any mage, tho it obviously works better on DoTs that can reapply it.

Youmuu's, which is a common buy on pretty much every AD assassin/caster and is even picked up on ADCs on occasion, Haunting Guise deserves a look as well. Liandry's isn't a bad item but it is hugely niche, that's why it's always picked up on the same champions and ignored by almost everyone else.

Yeah, I think the thing with Youmuu's is that although AD assissins/casters do buy it and get good use out of it, it's hard to argue it's actually optimal for them. If you could ask them if they'd rather just have 5 or 10% more CDR instead of the crit, or not have to buy the Avarice Blade, or a shorter, stronger active, they'd probably all jump at those options.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OEuPu2jN,comment-id=00020001000000000001,timestamp=2015-08-11T01:36:25.440+0000)

If you could ask them if they'd rather just have 5 or 10% more CDR instead of the crit, or not have to buy the Avarice Blade, or a shorter, stronger active, they'd probably all jump at those options.

To be fair, while I realise you're probably not related to any teams in charge of items, I think what you've just said about Youmuu's says a lot about AD assassin/caster itemisation as a whole. As someone who plays mages almost exclusively, I can tell you I'd be much happier to play people like Talon and Zed if their item choices didn't feel so incredibly bad. It's hard to find any item someone like Zed builds that doesn't feel suboptimal, because champions like that just have to pick and choose from items that quite honestly were intended for either ADCs or bruisers, Youmuu's being the only exception.

AD casters are in desperate need of items catering specifically to them, imo.
Well, all assassins except Critgar (Rengar with Infinity Edge). Ult + Ferocity Q + Youmuu = you're dead, no counterplay.

I guess I can see your point. I think Youmuu's is most commonly built on casters due to Brutalizer not building into anything else (other than Warrior Enchant), and on ADCs for other reasons. 

You've got a point about only certain champions building Liandry's. It's an item that should have seen a LOT of use during Tank Meta, if it were actually fulfilling its proper niche, I think. I guess it speaks volumes for it not to be popular on so many champions under the circumstances.

Since it's mostly balanced around DoT mages, maybe something could be done that allows it to tankbust effectively on other types of mage? I don't really have any ideas on that one, but Item Team comes up with some really cool stuff sometimes. Maybe they have something in mind?

Actually one quick idea, the base stats on Liandry's don't seem all that great for dealing with tanks because tanks have higher MR and build MR, while Liandry's offers Flat MPen. What if Liandry's ticks could lower magic resist or something? Idk, prolly not a good idea but that's all I have atm.

RR not only listening to the feedback, answering questions about nearly every balance/rework issue, but also sharing trivia about the behind the scene.

Hero of the Boards.

What do we have to do to get him a pay raise? He goes so far above and beyond the basic requirements of his position. The man is more than a mere hero of the boards paving the way for future glory, but the God of these boards, ushering in a new genesis of community interaction with representation from Riot. Being irreplaceable is the easiest way of not getting a promotion, though.

God it's so true. Corporate America sucks so effin' hard because of how their incentivization leads them to be risk-averse to the point of stagnation, causing a company with any degree of success to inevitably suffocate itself to death. There's just no way of knowing how much a person can actually do until you give them the chance to do it; but it's infinitely safer to just let them keep doing the thing you already know they can do forever, while keeping it just barely worth their while to stay at it. 

I guess it's a paradigm thing, but the consequences seem to be speaking for themselves, for any who care to listen.
Kinda odd that the one cheaper armor pen item doesn't build into last whisper.

The main reason you aren't likely to see this happen is because when upgrading, you would either lose the flat pen and cdr, or those things would have to be put onto Last Whisper as well. 

This is inherently problematic because if you put them on Last Whisper, it not only becomes super slot efficient, but also grants very strong effects against both tanks and squishies, which was the reason Flat Pen was taken off of Black Cleaver. If you lose the stats, then you defeat the purpose of having it build out of Brutalizer.

Essentially you would be recreating the problem that prompted the response that created the problem I'm talking about in the first place.

i'm kind of confused though, werent the previous garen nerfs to the full ad critgaren, why make his e scale with crit again?

Because when they took the crit away, it was a nerf that didn't really need to happen, as all it did was pigeonhole him further. The two biggest reasons why they brought it back, imo, are as follows:
1. Taking the crit away made one of his core items, Youmuu's Ghostblade, have a wasted stat. This wouldn't have been _game-changing_ or anything, but it would have been a nerf, as YG is extremely good on Garen.
2. Infinity Edge. Crit Garen isn't exactly super optimal. So when something that adds healthy diversity (oh boy, Riot buzzwords), why remove it? Garen can now go Infinity Edge if he's really far ahead. Again, probably not OP, so why take it away?

Oh good I really thought I was the only one thinking about this. It's been nagging at the back of my mind since the change, but the new Black Cleaver was such a good idea that I am so satisfied with that I just kinda let myself forget about the issue.

Were they also talking about the Warrior Enchantment while you had them on the subject? Because I don't think it's a secret that really no one who builds it is commonly played right now, despite the fact that those early game jungle bullies should be ideally suited to the role of shutting down these devourer guys.

Despite my earlier complaints, your discussion of the Garen rework in other threads has really set my mind at ease in terms of your capabilities and intent. (I had no idea you were involved in the Ashe project). So I think I owe you an apology for being so quick to be down on it. I'm really looking forward to getting my hands on it :)

And thanks for taking the time to talk with the community, even knowing that many of them will give you crap regardless. It means a lot to the rest of us.

Garen crits with his E again; they added that back in the 8/7 PBE changes. They dropped his AD Ratio on Judgment by .05 per spin (.50 total at 10 spins and Rank 5) to give it back.

I do still stand by my original statement about Brutalizer though, because of every other top laner who builds it. Garen is just the only one I can think of off-hand who can use the majority of Ghostblade's stats effectively (attack speed is a bit of a waste on him, but w/e).
